八丈絹: (はちじょうぎぬ) - plain-woven silk cloth produced on Hachijo Island (dyed with botanical pigments found on the island)
八丈縞: (はちじょうじま) - striped Hachijo silk cloth
八分: (はっぷん) - eight minutes; triangular-swept clerical script (clerical script whose horizontal lines end in a noticeable triangular tail)
八分儀座: (はちぶんぎざ) - Octans (constellation); the Octant
八分音符: (はちぶおんぷ) - {music} 8th note; eighth note; quaver
八切: (やつぎり) - octavo format (about 21.5 to 16.5 cm); cutting into 8 parts
八十代: (はちじゅうだい) - the eighties (age, years, etc.)
八十八夜: (はちじゅうはちや) - (yoji) eighty-eighth day from the beginning of spring
八十八箇所: (はちじゅうはっかしょ) - 88 temples (of, or modeled after those of, Shikoku)
八十神: (やそがみ) - many gods; many deities; many kami
八千年: (やちとせ) - 8000 years; thousands of years; eternity
八千歳: (やちとせ) - 8000 years; thousands of years; eternity
八千草: (やちくさ) - variety of plants; various herbs
八卦掌: (はっけしょう) - eight trigrams palm; Ba Gua Zhang or Pa Kua Chang
八双: (はっそう) - style of sword fighting
八口: (やつくち) - small opening in the side of some traditional Japanese clothing (located where the sleeve meets the bodice, below the armpit)
八咫: (やた) - eight ata (approx. 144 cm); (usu. やた) large/long
八咫の烏: (やたのからす) - Yatagarasu (mythical raven who aided Emperor Jimmu on his eastern expedition); three-legged crow inhabiting the sun in Chinese mythology
八咫の鏡: (やたのかがみ) - Yata no Kagami (the eight-span mirror; one of the Imperial regalia)
八咫烏: (やたがらす) - Yatagarasu (mythical raven who aided Emperor Jimmu on his eastern expedition); three-legged crow inhabiting the sun in Chinese mythology
八咫鏡: (やたかがみ) - Yata no Kagami (the eight-span mirror; one of the Imperial regalia)
八品詞: (はちひんし) - eight parts of speech (in traditional English grammar, etc.)
八哥鳥: (ハッカチョウ) - crested myna (Acridotheres cristatellus); crested mynah
八坂瓊曲玉: (やさかにのまがたま) - large jewel/string of jewels; Yasakani no Magatama (the grand jewel or string of jewels; one of the three Imperial regalia)
八大地獄: (はちだいじごく) - (yoji)  The Eight Greater Hells
八大明王: (はちだいみょうおう) - eight great wisdom kings (Acala, Kundali, Mezu, Munosho, Trilokavijaya, Ucchusma, Vajrayaksa, Yamantaka)
八姓: (はっせい) - eight hereditary titles (designated by Emperor Tenmu in 684 CE: Mahito, Asomi, Sukune, Imiki, Michinoshi, Omi, Muraji, Inagi)
八宗: (はっしゅう) - the two sects of Buddhism introduced to Japan during the Heian period (Tiantai and Shingon) and the six sects introduced during the Nara period
八家: (はっけ) - the eight early Japanese Buddhist sects; eight Japanese monks who visited China during the early Heian
八寸: (はっすん) - distance of eight sun (approx. 24 cm); dish or tray of this size (esp. used in kaiseki cuisine to serve several kinds of delicacies)/food served in such a dish; var. of thick, traditional Japanese paper
八専: (はっせん) - 49th, 51st, 52nd, 54th, 56th, 57th, 58th or 60th day of the sexagenary cycle (said to be inauspicious with a high probability of rain)
八将神: (はちしょうしん) - the eight gods who preside over the lucky-unlucky directions of the koyomi for each year
八尺瓊の勾玉: (やさかにのまがたま) - large jewel/string of jewels; Yasakani no Magatama (the grand jewel or string of jewels; one of the three Imperial regalia)
八尺瓊勾玉: (やさかにのまがたま) - large jewel/string of jewels; Yasakani no Magatama (the grand jewel or string of jewels; one of the three Imperial regalia)
八尺瓊曲玉: (やさかにのまがたま) - large jewel/string of jewels; Yasakani no Magatama (the grand jewel or string of jewels; one of the three Imperial regalia)
八岐大蛇: (やまたのおろち) - eight-headed, eight-tailed serpent (in Japanese mythology)
八州: (はっしゅう) - Japan; eight Edo-period provinces of Kanto (Sagami, Musashi, Awa, Kazusa, Shimousa, Hitachi, Kouzuke & Shimotsuke)
八帯アルマジロ: (ヤツオビアルマジロ) - great long-nosed armadillo (Dasypus kappleri)
八幡: (はちまん) - Hachiman (God of War); Hachiman shrine; certainly
八幡の不知藪: (やわたのやぶしらず) - labyrinth; maze
八幡の薮知らず: (やわたのやぶしらず) - labyrinth; maze
八幡宮: (はちまんぐう) - Shrine of the God of War
八幡神: (やわたのかみ) - Hachiman (god of war)
八戒: (はちかい) - the eight precepts (in addition to the five precepts, prohibitions against: lying in a luxurious bed; self-decoration, song & dance; and eating after noon)
八手: (やつで) - Japanese fatsia; Fatsia japonica; eight-fingered-leaf shrub
八掛: (はっかけ) - inside cloth used around cuff and hem
八文字: (はちもんじ) - (in) the shape of the character hachi (eight)
八方: (はっぽう) - all sides/the four cardinal directions and the four ordinal directions; large hanging lantern
八方ふさがり: (はっぽうふさがり) - all doors closed; blocked in every direction; cornered
八方丸くおさまる: (はっぽうまるくおさまる) - to find a solution (after struggle)
八方丸く収まる: (はっぽうまるくおさまる) - to find a solution (after struggle)
八方丸く治まる: (はっぽうまるくおさまる) - to find a solution (after struggle)
八方円満: (はっぽうえんまん) - (yoji) to the satisfaction of all parties; all sides being happy and satisfied
八方塞がり: (はっぽうふさがり) - all doors closed; blocked in every direction; cornered
八方手を尽くす: (はっぽうてをつくす) - to try all possible means
八方睨み: (はっぽうにらみ) - staring at or watching all sides
八方破れ: (はっぽうやぶれ) - full of holes (e.g. argument); vulnerable to any kind of attack (or criticism, etc.)
八方美人: (はっぽうびじん) - (yoji) one who is affable to everybody; a flunky; person beautiful from all angles; everybody's friend; person who shows people what they want to see
八方行灯: (はっぽうあんどん) - large hanging paper lantern
八日: (ようか) - the eighth day of the month; eight days
八月大名: (はちがつだいみょう) - the 8th month has the least work for farmers
八朔: (はっさく) - Hassaku orange (Citrus hassaku); 1st of August (lunar calendar)
八木・宇田アンテナ: (やぎ・うだアンテナ) - Yagi-Uda antenna
八極拳: (はっきょくけん) - Eight Extremities Fist
八橋: (やつはし) - type of sweet made with bean paste (local delicacy in Kyoto)/cinnamon-seasoned cracknel (cookie); zigzag bridge
八正道: (はっしょうどう) - noble eightfold path
八歳児: (やつご) - (八つ子 only) octuplet; eight-year-old child
